result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheldon Jules Thayer

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:16 PM Cases 22CF159, 2022CF000219, 2022CF000221, 2022TR000507, 2022TR000508, 2022TR000509, and 2022TR000510.  Defendant Sheldon Jules Thayer in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Sheldon Jules Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF219 and 22CF221 are on for preliminary hearings.  Off the record 2:18 PM.  Back on the record 2:25 PM, same appearances as previously noted.  Atty Erdman says 22CF219 will be a waiver, 22CF221 will be a preliminary hearing.  Case 22CF219 proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information. Case 22CF221 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Patrol Sergeant Clifford Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Erdman crosses.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Informations are to mirror complaints.  Cases 22CF219 and 22CF221 proceed to  Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:06 PM Cases 22CF159, 2022CF000219, 2022CF000221, 2022TR000507, 2022TR000508, 2022TR000509, 2022TR000510 called together.  Defendant Sheldon Jules Thayer in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Sheldon Jules Thayer.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF221 and 22CF219 on for initial appearances.  Atty Erdman makes record- will be taking Chapman off and Erdman to be assigned all of these cases.  Court reviews Criminal Complaints with def.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. WTLPH.  Bond continues.  Def to provide prints in the cases that need them.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
